solution_line_template: April has {days_in_april} days, so if he didn't walk the dog on Sundays, he worked for a total of {days_in_april} days - {sundays_in_april} days = <<{days_in_april}-{sundays_in_april}={days_worked}>>{days_worked} days.
If each day he earned ${earnings_per_day}, he ends up with {days_worked} days * ${earnings_per_day}/day = $<<{days_worked}*{earnings_per_day}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} .

After buying books and giving his sister ${given_to_kaylee}, he ends up with ${total_earnings} - ${cost_of_books} - ${given_to_kaylee} = $<<{total_earnings}-{cost_of_books}-{given_to_kaylee}={money_left}>>{money_left}
